comment: Woody notes with vanilla hits. Caramel also gets hit. Hardly any bite at all and very little burn. Very sweet Bourbon
Nice fruity smell. Slight alcohol burn, with a sweet finish.  Well worth the $35 per bottle. Definitely a good bourbon to serve guests who you want to come back.
Very nice. If you can get this at MSRP, grab it.

Fruit and caramel on the nose with oak and caramel on the palate.  Finish is moderate in length and cinnamon and spice followed by fruit and orange peel.  The value is remarkable if you can find it, it is getting nearly impossible to find.

Big fan! Apples/fruit up front, then a slight spice and onto caramel/nilla sweetness. Finish is short & smooth with no burn at all.  No single part punches you in the face but it all works so well together. Even a little tough guy leather on the aftertaste. Great offering at a low price point ($30 for a 750ml).
Fristratingly bad, pure alcohol burn with terrible taste. No nose whatsoever. Never again

Color: copper

Aroma: vanilla, cherry, caramel, and s’mores.

Taste: initial hit of peppery spice followed by sweet bread and worther's originals. Some warmth leads down the pipe and the opens to cherry-vanilla coke for a long finish.

Smooth factor: C
Lots of pear and apple initially on the nose, quite nice. Char, caramel and vanilla on the palette. Decent length finish, Kentucky hug. Would get again.

Nose: fruity, oak, old leather and chocolates, spearmint?
Palate: cinnamon sugar, vanilla, caramel. Red fruits and charred oak.
Finish: short. Peppery minty and oaky

Over all a good sipper that can be enjoyed all night. If you're looking for something slightly different than your standard sweet corn profile this fits the bill. It really is a nice pour. It would shine more at a higher proof, @ 90 proof it seems a little thin and watery. I really do like this one and always buy a bottle when I can find it.
Pepper, vanilla, oak, and kind of a medicine taste-like eucalyptus
I am loving this bourbon. All around good drinking bourbon.

Color: dark rust.

Aroma: cinnamon and banking spices.

Taste: nose carries forward to the palate and it has a coffee cake flavor that seems sweet.

Finish: shortish with flavors of gingerbread cookies.

Nose - classic bourbon nose, apple, cherry, leather, vanilla, almond, mild cinnamon, light ethanol burn. 

Taste - peanuts, caramel, vanilla, cherry, burnt brown sugar, moderately tannic, medium ethanol burn, finishing mildly sweet and spicy with a hint of leather.

Overall, an amazing value for the price. Solid bourbon notes all the way through, but falls slightly short of higher-end offerings.
Floral and citrus forward. My personal favorite so far. And only $34!!?? It’s a steal.
An excellent, affordable go-to option for Bourbon lovers.

Nose: toasted marshmallow.  Slight oak smell, but basically a perfectly roasted marshmallow straight from the fire. 

Palate: peppery (not spicy). Definitely can taste the oak with hints of honey.  Simple, but flavorful.  

Finish: mild finish - very smooth.  No alcohol burn - just a warm fuzzy feeling all over.  There is no one thing outstanding, but the all the parts combined makes this I damn good bourbon.  

Overall: Unlike many bourbons, Eagle Rare lives up to the hype.   Would make a great gift of appreciation for a co-worker.

The 10 year is very tasty.  Nose has lighter fruits, vanilla, toastiness, bit of spice and lots of sweetness.  The palette is surprisingly spicier than 90.  Oak, vanilla, and sweetness with decent spice.  A rather quick finish though but overall very tasty.
Sweet vanilla and honey. No much spice. No pepper
Very sweet, warm butter, absolutely no alcohol burn, very thick mouth feel
Better for me on the rocks
A great all around daily sipper at a affordable price!
Sweet and smooth, maple syrup/molasses taste
My Top Bourbon for the price.

매우 부드러운 숙성 버번
노즈 : 아이스크림 바닐라, 오크통의 태운 향, 브라운 슈가
테이스트: 약간의 스파이시함과 우디함, 적절한 단맛
피니쉬 : 다크 쵸콜렛의 쌉살함과 단맛, 슈가파우더의 단맛
One of the better bourbons I’ve had. Light, sweetish, perfect finish.
Will always have a bottle or 2 on hand

Arômes de fruits murs, caramel doux, bois, vanille, un peu de cannelle, cacao. En bouche, entrée de caramel avec un peu de pomme, brève présence de l'alcool qui nous laisse sur des saveurs bien boisées par la suite, quelques épices, cacao un peu grillé, poire, miel. Texture douce mais qui manque un peu de vigueur. Le 10 ans a fait son oeuvre avec ce bourbon plus reposé
Nice sweet carmel and smokey notes on the nose and taste. The finish is on the higher medium side. Get why it's called eagle "Rare." Lol
Smooth easy drinking...no burn at all, some sweetness

Nose - initial straw/hay notes up front custard, chocolate covered cherries
Palate - cake batter, nougat
Finish - tobacco, leather, and charred oak
Not bad but a little disappointing based on the hype I'd heard. Flavor is a bit one dimensional and flat.
Great sipper when not In the mood for higher abv
Had a bit of this at a friends house. Nose of some vanilla and a very slight spice. Velvety smooth and sweet . Finish fades to dry. Loved it
Perfect. Sweet, fruity and smooth. Would drink this everyday if I could find it.

First tasted at a friend's tasting party.

Nose: Dusty marshmallows, buttered cornbread, after-rain (probably from dishwasher detergent residue)

Taste: like Hibiki Harmony, this comes out of the clouds from a very modest nose. Big cherries up front, mild vanilla finish.
Extremely well balanced - oak, toffee, vanilla, orange peel, spice, and a hint of coconut.

I revisited this bottle after opening (about 4 to 6 weeks after opening).
I like this a lot more after it set for awhile. Very nice notes that are strong but a level of subtlety with some complexity.
I am really enjoying this drink now.
I love this bourbon. It is my favorite affordable go too.
Not so bad. My tastes are changing so I don’t like Eagle Rare as much as I used to but, it’s still better than average.

Buffalo Trace flagship bourbon huh? Definitely one of my Top Picks, when I can find it. I definitely get the cherries and oak off the nose. Maybe even some orange. Yumm. Oh! And honey.

Palate is getting vanilla, honey and oak for sure. So delicious... leaves me with the distinguishable touch of leather in my throat after.
Very sweet on the tongue initially. Strong taste of cherries and toasted almonds. The finish is super long and grows in leather notes. It’s ok, but the cherry overwhelms it for me.
Smooth, sweet, oak flavor. Very complex and smooth. A bargain with an amazing flavor. I found a new house favorite.
Very very smooth. Sweet. Vanilla. Fruity. Chocolate with the finish
This is my favorite every day bourbon will always keep it in stock
Caramel sweet, light spice, easy drinking
Smooth from start to finish.  I prefer to enjoy with one large Ice Cube, however, neat is equally as enjoyable, however, has a little bite at the start.

N - 89: Sweet and spicy, vanillas.  

T - 89: Mild oak taste. Cinnamon, bananas, honey.

F - 89: Medium finish. Oak and slight bitters.

89/100
Fruity and sweet. Overall stronger and spicier flavors than Buffalo Trace.
Stronger nose, darker than Buffalo Trace. Acetone palate

Very good nose. Notes of vanilla, Carmel and and a tiny floral smell. Not as impressed with this as I’d hoped, maybe it was too hyped. Definitely enjoy it, but it’s a bit sweet and has a strange aftertaste I can’t pinpoint.
Heavy. Cherries on the finish after it’s been open for a few weeks. Very nice.
Beautiful nose. Warm caramel and red-berry. Some harshness on the palate but a nice long custard finish. Really good benchmark bourbon
Very smooth and sweet, but not sickly sweet
Sweet but not over powering. Not very complex.   Almost flat.
Apple, rich well balanced bourbon.  Like this one.
One of the best bargains out there. Fruit and vanilla sweetness mixes with spices at the end. So smooth.
Outstanding value at $35. Rich flavor, spices and fruit. Not real spicy, but mellow and smooth. Terrific neat.

Nose: Strong Madagascar Vanilla. Deep, Sharp Oak Spice

Palate: Caramel and Vanilla with Chocolate forward, complimented by Cherry Cordial.

Finish: Apple Spiced and Leather
A classic. Dark cherry and bananas with a cinnamon and honey finish. Leather lingers at the end. Sophisticated and rugged.
Very smooth. Pretty complex for a bourbon this smooth. Lots of sweet notes, fruity, leathery, full bodied. Easy drinker and one of my favorites.
Words can not describe... Its a great go to bourbon when ever you can get it. Very balanced, sweet, hint of oak, light cherry, touch of leather, hint of tobacco.

Eagle Rare represents everything you look for in a bourbon. Well balanced. Smooth. Delicious. Great value. How many 10 year old bourbons can be purchased for low $30s. Not many. I have to say this is my favorite from a value perspective. A pound-for-pound champion, if you will. I definitely recommend.
Standard Eagle Rare 10 + Total Wine Single Barrel
Smooth and sweet tasting on my palette
A good bourbon at a very reasonable price!

Nose: sweet, fruity, vanilla
Taste:  vanilla, woody a bit of spice
Finish:  cherries, oak, light caramel and vanilla

I am finally getting around to writing this after receiving a bottle of Eagle Rare over the holidays. This is a solid but somewhat hard to find Bourbon (in my area) that seems to have a bigger flavor than Buffalo Trace. It has a wonderful vanilla nose and sweetness or fruitness that I really liked with the finish being a slow release with a touch of wood. I really, really like to way the flavor lingers in my mouth. I prefer this on the rocks vs neat I think the dilution opens up this Bourbon a great deal. This stuff makes an outstanding Old Fashioned the flavors in this go with the bitters very well and next to Sazerac rye it is my favorite spirit to make an Old Fashioned. I usually make a Manhatten evaluate the spirit, but unfortunately, my sweet vermouth had turned and when I mixed it the drink tasted like burnt pencil erasers and while I did try to finish it the drink terrible. Overall I really like this stuff and will continue to stock it in my bar. I have read many of the reviews and am a bit worried about finding a bad bottle but still as Robin Hood said in the Disney version "the faint heart never won the fair maiden". I enjoyed this enough to continue to stock this as space is available in my bar. Enjoy.
I get too much heat from this and not much else, it's good but rather mediocre in my opinion
Delicious- fruity, caramel and a hint of leather. Eagle call!

A normal bourbon, nothing too special, but not a bad dram.

Bottled at 45%abv, with a russetmuscat color.

On the nose is a typical bourbon, but not complex at all. Banana, banana split, vanilla ice cream. Clove. 

On the palate is fair, it is a thick dram, with tangerine, lots of pepper and clove. Finish is warm and pleasant but could be more interesting. 

Adding water to this dram will reveal lemon notes on the nose and more spicy on the palate. 

Overall i give this dram an 82 over 100 and would recommend it only if you find it cheap, since i wouldn't pay more than 40 dollars for it.
Always feel like I should like this more considering Buffalo Trace produces

Sweet, dark cherry. Apples roll into an oaky, vanilla, and honey richness. Leathery molasses finish with thick honey that lingers.  Overall, a good one. Does it knock my socks off? No. Will I buy it again? Yes.

I am a big fan of this Bourbon, and I feel like it might be the one that gets me full time on the Bourbon train. The nose is devoid of much corn, but instead has a cinnamon spice in the aroma.

The taste is more cinnamon, potpourri, and a good amount of charcoal. A little bit of heat burns through. The corn emerges here along with cracked wood. 

That finish stays on the Cinnamon brand. The burn is pleasant and non-threatening. Sits in the tongue comfortably. Old tobacco pulls up the rear, again like a, comfortable pair of slippers. Some rich woods come out too.
Best bourbon I've ever had. Very smooth, rich flavor
One of our favorites for the money

This is a toned down buffalo trace with slightly more spicy complexity. I’m a bigger fan of buffalo trace honestly. Buffalo trace just has more of the flavour I want out of a bourbon and at a cheaper price point. Both are great!

A flavor bomb of caramel, vanilla and spicy cherries. Amazing stuff, especially for the price point. 

Nose - caramel, vanilla, orange zest and a hint of almonds
Taste - the vanilla caramel and honey kick things off, then some spice and cherry. Ones through
Finish - lingering spice with a bit off heat, finishes with cherry notes
Solid bourbon. Especially at the price point. Finishes a little sweeter.
Very solid bourbon - especially for the price. Full flavor profile and sweet. Classic BT product.
I like it, I like it better with a cylinder ice ball. It just tasted better with it.

The usual bourbon flavors don't last long and end with a woody, bitter finish. (The 10 years in barrel is evident).  Adding one teaspoon of water immediately improves the flavor, while the mouthfeel is lost.  The finish remains oaky, bitter, and chewy.  An average score - however, the bottle design blows the socks off any other bourbon bottle. Is it worth the $35 I paid?  It does.  While I'll never refuse a glass, I won't be picking up a bottle anytime soon.



My Rating Glossary:  

Two Stars:           "I'd rather be drinking lite beer."
Two 1/2 Stars:    "Posh rubbish."
Three Stars:        "I love whisk(e)y.  This is average love."
Three 1/2 Stars: "May buy again."
Four Stars:          "I've got to get you into my life."
Four 1/2 Stars:   "Better than drugs."
Five Stars:           "Life is good.  Whisky makes it better."

One of my first intros to bourbon. Crazy how complex and smooth this is for the price. Nose has a mix of bananas foster and vanilla bean. Taste is apple, spice, and leather on the finish. Makes awesome old fashions. Buying another after this one's done.
Was Exited to get my hands on a bottle of this given its reputation. It’s pretty solid, I understand the hype. There are better pours out there but very good for the price. Must try!

Smells sweet and buttery. Starts off with a quick citrus and pepper note then quickly mellows as it rolls to the back releasing into buttery almonds, chocolate, and cherry. Very dry mouth feel with a short to medium finish. No burn but a good Kentucky Hug and very smooth. Additional sips keep getting sweeter and aromatic.
This stuff is a bargain and I’m lucky that it’s readily available in my area for now.
Sweet and a little spicy. Vanilla, fruit, and honey flavors
A fruity spiced joy! Drinking in the UK, prices have dropped here a touch, now £30 a bottle, great value.
Sweet tasting upfront with a smooth caramel finish.
A real gem for the price. Purchased a 1.75ltr bottle. Banana and vanilla on the nose. Apple, caramel, and spice on the finish. Definitely going to keep this one stocked in the bar.
Very floral and fruity on the nose. On the palate, notes of green apple, Caramel, light cinnamon and vanilla. Long finish with hints of corn coming through.

Nose: light caramel, oak, orange peel, hint of vanilla.

Palate: orange peel, caramel, toffee, anise, hints of oak.

Finish: dark toffee, hint of chocolate and vanilla. Lingers on the sides of the tongue.

YUM. Period. 
Nose =   fruity gummies (yup!)
Palate = vanilla, sweet followed by a spicy note on the finish. 

Pure enjoyment.

Nose: cream soda, honey, oak

Palate: honey, oak, cinnamon, ripe fruit

Finish: leather, oak
Nice flavor. Brown sugar and mild spice. Mild metal after taste this time. Medium finish
Outstandingly smooth. Vanilla, honey, molasses, fruity leather.

nose- slight cherry and oak on the nose
palate- brown sugar, cinnamon, fruit leather
finish- slight oak, grape
Out of all of the older aged bourbons I’ve had, this has the smoothest oak/wood flavor to it. The nose was very sweet and just an all around balanced bourbon IMO.

Only reason I won’t give it a 5 is that I want to be able to rate double rare higher, still haven’t been able to get my hands on it. 

So rich and smooth.
Oaky, Spicy, hint of port wine
Wow!  Hard to find, but a great deal.  Delicious well rounded bourbon with sweet honey and caramel flavors.  Full bodied and delightful.
Expectations are high. Nose is pleasant. Oh, that is flavorful and smooth.
Excellent bourbon easy to drink neat.

Fruity, extremely smooth, cherry, fruits give way to baking spices over time. Would be a great daily if widely available, too one dimensional to be exceptional. 

I use the rating scale below. Distiller uses a scale of 5 and I use a scale of 10, but I’m sure you’re not too drunk to do the math! 

1. Disgusting - So bad I poured it out.
2. Poor - I wouldn't consume by choice.
3. Bad - Multiple flaws.
4. Below average - Not bad, but many things I'd rather have.
5. Good - Just average.
6. Very Good - Better than average.
7. Great - Well above average.
8. Excellent - In a league of its own.
9. Incredible - An all-time favorite.
10. Perfect

Nose: warm orange peels, vanilla. copper, like i shoved a penny in my nose. bits of clove and allspice. hint of browned butter

taste: pleasantly warm. slightly thin. orange forward again. no metal. more clove. 

finish: watered down honey syrup with just a bit of candied ginger, fading into vanilla and that metallic note from the nose

delicious, well worth the money

Another bottle I’m coming back to again for a taster.
Nose - sweet, some vanilla, leather. Picking up something else maybe fruity or floral but subtle

Taste - sweet and complex. Starts off sweet and a bit fruity. Smooth finish long lasting on the tongue with some cinnamon that eventually gets a little bitter.

Overall and value
A super smooth and complex 10 year bourbon for around 30$? Yes please! This is a very solid bourbon. My only issue is it’s availability and allocation. Very hard to find in my area. Solid choice for all bourbon lovers.

Nose: straight maraschino cherry, so sweet, with sweet barrel tannins
Palate: so smooth on the front of the tongue, barrel sour note at the end, dark chocolate and carmels
Rounded, vanilla, smooth and just a touch thin
Very smooth mouth feel. Nice burn from start to finish. Wood flavors standout.
Smooth and flavorful a slight notch below 4 roses single barrel
Could not get over the medicinal cherry note on the initial palate.
Smooth.  Strong but balanced. Got better with a little ice.  Quality bourbon

A great bourbon. The price seems to be climbing to nearly $50 in many shops, but if you can find it at the SRP of around $30-35, it is a bargain for a classy complex bourbon. It noses of vanilla, heated brown sugar, oak, and a little dark cherry. These flavors are resplendent on the tongue. There is also heat, perhaps a little more than the typical 10 year old bourbon. On the finish there is cinnamon and all-spice blending with corn sweetness and old leather. Very good, the senior class of Buffalo Trace bourbon.

My only knock on this bourbon is the nose, theirs really nothing to it or anything remarkable. Everything else, is awesome! Such an enjoyable bourbon, that's not sickenly sweet and at 45 percent alcohol, it gives it enough kick to be interesting. I'm definitely looking at a repeat bottle purchase, this is my new go to bourbon, edging out four roses single barrel.

Color: Maple Brown (nearly the same as my EH Taylor Small Batch), long streaky legs on the twirl - oily

Nose: Pears, Apple Pie, Vanilla, Oak, Chocolate, a slightly muted copper/metal

Taste: Marzipan, Orange, Vanilla, Caramel, Apple Hi-Chews, Oak/Pepper bite

Finish: Sweet fruity aftertaste with a hint of cinnamon that lingers, and an ever so slight coat of wax on the tongue for good measure

Overall: This is shockingly similar to my bottle of EH Taylor SmB, which can retail for $30+ more here in NYC. The nose and palate are somewhat muted, but this dram punches well above its weight class. Will be using this as my nightly bourbon pour!

(5/1/20)

I've always liked Eagle Rare.
It's a step up from Buffalo Trace, but below Weller 107 and Taylor. 
At its original sub $30 price point it's an excellent bourbon.  Now, as it creeps higher, it has trouble justifying it's price.
Solid bourbon, standard brown sugar and caramel flavors.  Strong ethanol burn on the finish. Not bad but I’d rather go with Russell’s Reserve which I think has more depth at the same price point.

Nose - Honey, vanilla and red fruits with subtle oak
Taste - Orange zest, apple, clove with a touch of leather
Finish - Cinnamon transitions gently into milk chocolate
Easily the best bourbon on the market.
Sweet almost caramel scent with a smooth and slight spicy flavor
Sweet caramel on the nose, medium bodied, smooth all the way through. Rich flavour, clove, berry.
Aroma - vanilla and toffee with sweet fruit / taste - subtle spice with orange peel and oak / finish- too thin for my taste. Lasting spice and wood
I really get the caramel and honey on this, and it has a really long finish which is great.  Really easy, could be an everyday drink at this price point.
Nice easy to drink. One of the best for the price
Mediocre. Just okay. Would not purchase again based on first glass. Will see how it does next time around.

Nose- nice- cherry- honey- 
P- vanilla- light oak and leather 
Finish - nice - more heat - chocolate- Carmel- smooth - warm finish  - 
Solid bourbon- won a blind tasting vs OF Statesman- Bakers 7 yrs- and Russel Single B
Cherry , brown sugar , baking spice and everything nice .
Single Barrel Select for the state of Kansas: Strong vanilla on the nose with caramel, vanilla reappears on finish. Up front spice quick to calm, good oak presence. Very enjoyable.
Caramel, ripe fruits, allspice, some smoke/wood. Very perfumy nose. Mild sweetness with astringent, lasting warming mouth feel. Nose much better than taste
Fruit and honey on the nose as well as the palate at first. Coats the mouth with a tiny bit of spice, but the fruit flavors remain and mesh with the sweet brown sugar for a great finish.
Quite a bite but lots of flavor
Fantastic! Very smooth and sweet. Could sip on this all day.

So very cherry! Cherry lip salve to be precise.

A unique (in my experience) product. Yes, the top line tastes of caramel and cocoa and apple at the sweeter end are delivered with some power. Enough tart to avoid any charge of being sickly. The overall sensation is warm and pleasing and comforting. Then. In the mouth. Cherry. Then. An aftertaste that lingers forever. Cherry.

Did I say I got cherry?

A real bargain and an easy drop to like.
Nose is amazing. Apples, grapes, runts. Thinner in taste.

Nose: so much apple in this, toffee, and vanilla notes
Palate: green apple, cinnamon, caramel, and oak
Finish: medium long finish, as the green apple starts to fade the caramel and  cinnamon spice become more pronounced tasting like a fancy candied apple

Overall: not an extreme amount of nuance, but exceedingly pleasant. The green apple throughout this is surprising and fresh. This is my favorite bottle of ER to date. Once my wife has a sip of this it will be hard to keep it around.

Very good and full of flavor weather you
have it neat or served with ice. Slight spice with hints of vanilla, caramel & some fruit notes. Very smooth and definitely one to have I’m the collection.
It’s just the perfect daily drinker. Good proof. Good flavors. Single barrels are very interesting. Easy to drink.
light, hints of berry and vanilla
So good! If I had to only drink one and could get it... this could be it.
More complex than Buffalo Trace. Tasty
great bottle, like basil heyden but better
Sweetness of honey and Carmel. With a finish of spice and some toasted oats.
Great cherry sweetened with long mouth feel and great character. A must have!!

It’s true. This is one of the best values you can find in any whiskey/bourbon realm. Smells great with a hint of banana. Smooth, floral, vanilla, with solid amount of fruit in taste profile. Long and oily finish. Solid drink.
A lovey balance, very smooth and sweet.
Smooth. Light barrel. A solid weekday sipper.
Honey and cinnamon with vanilla, caramel, and oak.
Simply one of the best. And the price makes it very popular
Nose: honey, vanilla, little citrus. Taste: honey, nuts with a small dry peppery finish.
Cherry, vanilla, spice.... it’s sweet; but yet a rugged finish that’s beyond smooth.. this one just hits different. It’s a combination of everything!

Apricot, cinnamon, apple, caramel. Smooth, and finishes easy. Finishes easier than 4 roses single barrel IMO - great neat and a bit thin to my pallate when on ice due to smoothness and fruit forward notes. 
My taste appreciates its ease of drink ability , price point, and approachability to both the advanced and novice whiskey drinker.

My favorite bourbon  so far. Took a little bit of searching but I managed to find a 750 ml for 25.99 which I felt was an absolute STEAL! Heavy notes of oak and cherry on the nose and smooth soft finish with hints of vanilla  long oily fingers inside the glass this was the best pour I've ever had.
One of my favorites, wish we could find it more often in NC these days.
Sweet dried fruits, some chocolate on the nose, oak with warm finish
Very complex, full bodied, slightly oily. Lingers on the tongue.

This is a very drinkable and enjoyable bourbon, considering that I drink mostly rum and scotch.  The nose was very attractive with traditional bourbon notes, the palate was full, oak and sweet caramel.  The finish was lasting and flavorful.   Now I see why this one is so hard to find.   Excellent value.
Immediately knew it was BT product. Seemed more complex though. Very nice.
Fruit and vanilla nose. Fruit and sweet grain in the mouth, to caramel and oak. Smooth finish. Great value in a 10 year bourbon with no real flaws.
Might be the best bourbon I’ve had to date. Plum up front? Then spice/heat kicks in but fades quick to sweetness. Caramel. $32? Crazy good price, tastes like a $70 bottle.
Nose is dark cherries. Has some Chinese five spice tastes. Great value
I like it better on this second tasting. Can definitely taste bananas and cherries. Hint of cinnamon.
Wow! This is very nice to neophyte but maturing palate.

Nose
Orange, red apple, honey

Palate
Nutty
Vanilla vanilla vanilla 
Caramel 
Cinnamon 
Wood spice

Finnish 
Waxy

Nose: sweet and rich
Palate: sweet
Finish: at least today I’m actually getting a bit of spice? Normally this is sweet and smooth on the finish

Definitely a good bottle, and for the price hard to beat.
Caramel and vanilla on the nose and throughout the first sip with hints of dark cherry and a light sice of cinnamon and pepper
Nose is dark berries, banana, and cream. Taste is a sweet berry, vanilla, cinnamon and oak. Finish is medium long of a sweet cinnamon and oak.
Warm but pleasantly so.  Vanilla, leather, balsam, oak, and spice.  Dry finish with amaretto hints. Really lends itself to an old fashioned and needs very little finish
A great tasting bourbon for the price. It stands head over heels compared to higher priced bourbons. My main go to.

Nose: Leathery and sweet with Carmel and Vanilla notes

Taste: nose matches the taste. Dark Cherries, apples, and bananas wrapped in leather with A hint of spice and clove
Cherry, vanilla, cinnamon,and orange zest. Strong nose light finish
Strong flavor. Loved it. Vanilla and butterscotch.

Nose: Corn, vanilla, cinnamon, banana 
Neat: Small burn; good mix of sweet and heat; surprisingly a little more banana 
Rocks: Vanilla, caramel, banana, cherry

Warm vanilla nose, hint of fruit—maybe banana, & more alcohol on the smell than I was anticipating. Super sweet build into a full finish. Light notes & typical bourbon flavors, but it’s set apart by such a mild feel, it’s almost like it’s melting. Very interesting and very good. It’s a must have bottle. Swings WAY above it’s price point.

Taste of dark cherries and banana, with a hint of spice, then a smooth leathery finish.

Opened this bottle for my three year anniversary today!!

Nose to tongue to finish Eagle is 6000% candy. Spectacular beyond words, for a 90 proof to hit like a 120 is amazing. Not to hot, but long lasting warmth. Sweet caramel sauce, cotton candy, sweet fair corn, pie crust.

Brownish, Copper -  sweet oak, Maple, cinnamon or nutmeg, perfume, vanilla comes out.
Flavor Nutty and a touch Minty at first. Opens to lots of vanilla cream & sweet oak. 
Two drops of water kick up the spice.  Finish is not deep or complex which keeps this just below a 4.0 for me.  But still wonderful
Smooth.  Hints of cocoa & honey.  A top 5 favorite.
Extremely smooth and mellow, but still rich in flavor. Hints of cherry and almond on the nose, vanilla and caramel on the finish.
A little more burn then other higher end 10yrs but all the flavor is there. Solid buy

Nose: Maple syrup, vanilla, butter, and a hint of cranberry
Palate: Sharper than the nose lets on, very balanced. Still has that delicious bourbon sweetness with a spike of ginger and citrus. Cinnamon comes out a little bit as you sip. 
Finish: It fades fast but leaves a pleasant vanilla longer than anything else.

Vanilla, cinnamon, butter, maple syrup? French toast in a bottle!
Surprisingly tasty. Carmel, maple, oak - smooth
Smooth, sweet. Great nose and finish

This bourbon plays on the nose very similar to Buffalo trace, which makes sense given its lineage. You are greeted with familiar scents of cherry and burnt orange wrapped in a delicate vanilla package.

Palate is initially rich and sweet, loaded with caramel and baking spice. In the background there is also chocolate which I don’t normally find in bourbons so it’s a welcome addition.

It transitions to finish smoothly, giving far more warmth then you expect and lasting far longer too.

When you’re finished with your sip you are left reflecting on how rich and full it was, and while not complex, the rounded edges make it taste far more expensive then it is.

This is essentially your next step for any lover of standard Buffalo Trace. The extra few years and more choice warehouse placement add welcome complexity and flavor intensity. Mellow toasted sugar, cherry, and vanilla give that cozy bourbon feeling. Simply a yummy bourbon that kills considering the price.
Sweet. The mix of all different types of flavors makes it busy. Hard to pin down anyone distinctive flavor. Surprisingly hot.
Good bourbon for the price but way better stuff out there in my opinion

Nose: Candy apple, vanilla, butter scotch and maple syrup.

Taste: surprisingly smooth with more candy.

Notes: For a 10 year bourbon, I was expecting more. Maybe try with ice or a few drops of water next time.
Classic bourbon but real good. Burnt, caramelized sugar. Medium finish. Happiness.

I love this bourbon. It's sexual and violent. I think you might like it.  

But don’t pay more than $35 for it.
Love the fruit flavor. Cinnamon kicks though.

Ripe apple on the nose. Almost empty upfront of anything. Very smooth mid and finish with the same ripe apple and mild barrel spice. Easy drinker but not very complex. Great for those just beginning on burbon.
